meanings.definition: The upper jaw or jawbone in vertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The maxillae of the lion help it to catch and chew its food.
meanings.sent2: The dentist examined the patient's maxillae to check for any issues.
meanings.sent3: The maxillae of the dinosaur were so big, they could probably eat a whole tree in one bite!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as strong as the maxillae of a crocodile, able to tear through any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The maxillae, like a gate, opened wide to welcome the delicious meal.

meanings.definition: The two fused bones forming the upper jaw in insects and other arthropods.
meanings.sent1: The tiny ant uses its maxillae to carry food back to the colony.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the structure of the insect's maxillae under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The beetle's maxillae were so strong, they could probably lift a small rock!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as unyielding as the maxillae of a bee, always working tirelessly.
meanings.sent5: The maxillae, like delicate tools, delicately manipulated the tiny pieces of food.
